required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identification of Entamoeba Spp. in Assuit Governorate
clinical_study.official_title: Different Methods for Detection and Identification of Entamoeba Species in Assuit Governorate.

brief_summary.textblock:
1. Determination the prevalence of Entamoeba histolytica infections among patients at Assiut University Hospitals presented with diarrhea/dysentery.
2. Evaluatation the role of different cultures in diagnosing Entamoeba .
3. Molecularly differentiation between Entamoeba species to monitor the true prevalence of E.histolytica .

detailed_description.textblock: Entamoeba histolytica is a common pathogenic protozoan widely distributed throughout the world (10% of the world's population), with 50,000-100,000 deaths reported annually(1) .It is a health problem both in Egypt and worldwide (2) The disease is more prevalent in densely populated areas with poor hygiene requirements and lacking sanitary water supply, especially in rural areas(3). It causes many digestive complications including diarrhea , and fever(2). it transmits through bloodstream forming abscesses in the brain, eye, liver and other vital organs and tissues or even lead to death in some cases . Some individuals have no symptom of the disease but transmit the infection to others(4) It is well- established that E. histolytica leads to invasive disease in humans. Although both E. dispar and E. moshkovskii are still considered to be non pathogenic and free-living amoebas, respectively, some reports suggest their potential role in provoking disease in humans (5) Cysts of E.dispar , E.moshkovskii and E.hartmanni can be confused with E.histolytica. cysts in the parasitological examination(6) The molecular assays, is preferable as it detects E. histolytica , differentiates it from other species and monitors its true prevalence for better treatment and effective control (2)

primary_outcome.measure: Determination the prevalence of Entamoeba histolytica infections among patients at Assiut University Hospitals presented with diarrhea/dysentery
primary_outcome.description: Different Methods for Detection and Identification of Entamoeba species in Assuit Governorate.

intervention.description: A stool sample will be collected from each patient for diagnosis of Entamoeba

study_pop.textblock: Male and female patients of different age groups with diarrhea/dysentery attending the outpatient clinics at Assiut University Hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- : Male and female patients of different age groups with diarrhea/dysentery attending the outpatient clinics at Assiut University Hospitals .
Exclusion Criteria:
- No exclusion criteria .
